segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 48
segments.en: Linked Discourses 48

segments.pli: 5. Jarāvagga
segments.en: 5. Old Age

segments.pli: 49. Piṇḍolabhāradvājasutta
segments.en: 49. About Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja

segments.pli: Evaṃ me sutaṃ—
segments.en: So I have heard.

segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kosambiyaṃ viharati ghositārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmatā piṇḍolabhāradvājena aññā byākatā hoti:
segments.en: Now at that time Venerable Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja had declared enlightenment:

segments.pli: “khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyāti pajānāmī”ti.
segments.en: “I understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”

segments.pli: Atha kho sambahulā bhikkhū yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu. Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho te bhikkhū bhagavantaṃ etadavocuṃ:
segments.en: Then several mendicants went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened. Then they said,

segments.pli: “Āyasmatā, bhante, piṇḍolabhāradvājena aññā byākatā:
‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānāmīti.
Kiṃ nu kho, bhante, atthavasaṃ sampassamānena āyasmatā piṇḍolabhāradvājena aññā byākatā:
segments.en: “What reason does Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja see for doing this?”

segments.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānāmī”ti?
“Tiṇṇannaṃ kho, bhikkhave, indriyānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā piṇḍolabhāradvājena bhikkhunā aññā byākatā:
segments.en: “It’s because Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja has developed and cultivated three faculties that he declares enlightenment:

segments.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānāmīti.
segments.en: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.”’

segments.pli: Katamesaṃ tiṇṇannaṃ?
segments.en: What three?

segments.pli: Satindriyassa, samādhindriyassa, paññindriyassa—
segments.en: The faculties of mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tiṇṇannaṃ indriyānaṃ bhāvitattā bahulīkatattā piṇḍolabhāradvājena bhikkhunā aññā byākatā:
segments.en: It’s because Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja has developed and cultivated these three faculties that he declares enlightenment.

segments.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānāmīti.
Imāni ca, bhikkhave, tīṇindriyāni kimantāni?
segments.en: What’s the culmination of these three faculties?

segments.pli: Khayantāni.
segments.en: They culminate in ending.

segments.pli: Kissa khayantāni?
segments.en: In the ending of what?

segments.pli: Jātijarāmaraṇassa.
segments.en: Of rebirth, old age, and death.

segments.pli: ‘Jātijarāmaraṇaṃ khayan’ti kho, bhikkhave, sampassamānena piṇḍolabhāradvājena bhikkhunā aññā byākatā:
segments.en: It’s because he sees that they culminate in the ending of rebirth, old age, and death that Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja declares enlightenment:

segments.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānāmī”ti.
segments.en: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.”’”

segments.pli: Navamaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: Having developed mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom the mendicant Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja declared his awakening.
